issue.title: Gazebo-2.1.0 fails to compile on ARM

content.raw:
Indeed, seems like ARM does not support non PIC code in the shared libraries, but x86 can handle this kind of built (shared library with no PIC code).

This change will [impact in the performance](http://hardwarebug.org/2009/01/02/shared-library-woes-and-the-price-of-pic/) (no PIC -> PIC), probably nothing very critical. [Debian policy](https://www.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/ch-files.html) is against using no PIC for shared libraries, so it is a good reason to go with your proposal. I will prepare the PR.
